_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: All Other Basic Organic Chemical Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Emerald Kalama Chemical, LLC

Executive Summary

The facility is committed to reducing the risk of harm posed by the use of hazardous substances to our employees, contractors, neighbors and community.  In support of this commitment it is the policy of facility management to support, promote and implement accident release prevention and emergency response.

Facility Description (Stationary Source)
Name: Emerald Kalama Chemical, LLC
Address: 1296 Third Street NW,  Kalama, WA  98625-9799
EPA ID#: WAD092899574

The facility is located on the north boundary of the city of Kalama, Washington, near Columbia River mile post 74.  The facility operates 24 hours a day, 365 days per year.  The site consists of 155 acres, 39 of which are developed.

Acetaldehyde is the only substance present on the plant site above the threshold quantity for RMP planning (10,000 pounds).  Acetaldehyde is used in the manufacture of flavoring and/or frangrance products.  The maximum quantity of acetaldehyde is limited by administrative procedures and storage capacity.

The worst case release scenario would result in an off-site impact.  Administrative Controls and Mitigation Measures such as operating and emergency response programs are in place to limit the impact distance and severity.  Alternative Release Scenarios were considered via the Process Hazard Analysis (PHA)  program.  The facility has an emergency response plan designed to respond to and mitigate the Alternative Release Scenarios identified in the PHA studies.  The plan has been reviewed and modified as necessary to coordinate with the community emergency response plans.

There have been no events involving acetaldehyde at the facility in the RMP reporting history.
